page.title: 07IVER
page.content: Iver is situated in the valley of the Colne Brook on undulating land.The first record of the village was in 893 A.D. The main occupation around Iver is agriculture. Iver is a commuter village,therefore housing is expensive ranging from small cottages (Â£52,500) to large family homes (Â£100,000+). Iver is a conservation area and fine examples of historic achitecture are Bridgefoot Manor and Iver House. Section 227 of the 1971 Town and Country Planing Act defines conservation areas as areas of special architectural or historic interest whose character or appearance is desirable to preserve or enhance the environment. Delaford Manor is situated on the site of Iver Court. Iver is in a conservation area worthy of preservation.
